intro: Rorippa pyrenaica subsp. hispanica, commonly known as the Pyrenean watercress, is a member of the Brassicaceae family. It is a small, herbaceous plant typically found in moist or aquatic environments. The plant has alternate, ovate leaves that are usually submerged or floating. Its flowers are small, white, and arranged in racemes, typical of the mustard family. It is native to the Iberian Peninsula and is adapted to grow in freshwater habitats.
